results.title: Franco: the story of an immigrant
results.creator_credit: Fine Film Productions, Salvatore Greco and Randall Richardson
results.brief_description: Franco, an italian immigrant employed as a labourer, is doubtful about the advantages of living in Canada. He becomes nostalgic for the old country and makes arrangements to return with his wife and family. An encounter with an old friend helps him to open his eyes to reality.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fine Film Productions, Salvatore Greco and Randall Richardson

results.title: Franco Zeffirelli's production of Verdi's Don Carlo
results.creator_credit: Radiotelevisione Italiana, EMI/Parlophone, Teatro alla Scalla, ENT and Franco Zeffirelli
results.brief_description: This is Zeffirelli’s interpretation of Verdi’s classic tale of love and betrayal. It is an opera in four acts live at La Scala, Milan in 1992. Performers include: Luciano Pavarotti, Samuel Ramey, Daniela Dessi, Paolo Coni, Luciana d’Intino, Alexander Anisimov. Orchestra e coro del Teatro alla Scalla (Milan) conducted by Riccardo Muti.
results.title_for_label: Franco Zeffirelli’s production of Verdi’s Don Carlo

results.title: Francisco Pizarro
results.creator_credit: Michael Latham, Fred Burnley and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
Depicts the events leading to the destruction of the Inca civilization by Europeans. In the wake of the civil war there was little to stop the invasion of Pizarro and his conquistadores and the Inca civilization fell because of Pizarro’s greed for power and wealth. Written by Ian Thorne and presented by David Attenborough.

results.title: Francesca baby
results.creator_credit: Martin Tahse, Martin Tahse Productions and Larry S. Elikann
results.brief_description: Presents an adaptation of the novel of the same title by Joan L. Oppenheimer, about a teenage girl and her younger sister who try to cope with their alcoholic mother. Shows how the teenage girl joins Alateen and how a series of dramatic events mark the beginning of a new life for the girls.

results.title: France: the Rhone Valley
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the varied physical, human and economic geography of the Rhone lowlands and emphasises the extent to which the people of this region are dependent on the river. The varied character of the relief, climate and agriculture of the enclosed plains south of Lyons, of the Carmargue, Languedoc and the Crau is shown in stages. The importance of the river as a source of irrigation water and power and the use of the valley as a transport route are stressed.

results.title: France: soaring with the senses. Parts 1 & 2
results.brief_description: Fast moving action and adventure as press attache Marie Francoise Guichard shows off the delights of France. Features a barge trip along the Canal du Midi, a journey by France’s latest triumph of technology to Corsica, a hot air balloon flight across the chateaux of the Loire Valley, Bastille Day celebrations in Paris with military parades and concerts, culminating in a climb up Mont Blanc and a parapente flight through the French Alps. Features characters such as Maurice Herzog and Paul Bocuse.

results.title: France: background for literature
results.brief_description: Recaptures the France of the stories of Hugo, Balzac, Maupassant and Poe. Showing scenes in Paris, Versailles, Fountainbleau, Orleans, Chateau d’If, Marseilles and Normandy, the film provides a background for existing literature but does not attempt to recreate the actual scenes of stories.

results.title: France panorama. [Special edition. 14th July Parade]
results.brief_description: Special edition of France Panorama about Bastille Day, as it was celebrated from the turn of the 20th century to the current day. Traditionally it is a day for the French to celebrate the storming of the Bastille and a chance to demonstrate their military might. Includes archival news footage from the 1900s, 1930s and 1940s.
